ComicInfo.Summary:
Spoof story about Hellboy taking a vacation in Hell.
Johann Kraus tries to stop an alien from taking over a S.E.T.I. station.
Spoof story about Kate Corrigan being haunted by the ghost of her mother.
Hellboy spends a day at the Boardwalk, then has pancakes later.
Roger talks with a "therapist" about one of his missions.
Liz Sherman and Abe Sapien fight with a monster in an aquarium.
Spoof story about Hellboy having "gremlin trouble" with B.P.R.D. office equipment.
Hellboy investigates a Japanese toy manufacturer's warehouse that is haunted by the ghosts of children.
Hellboy goes on a camping trip.
Liz Sherman is sent to investigate a demon-possessed house.
B.P.R.D. agents try to deal with a monster fetus.
Spoof story about the "atmosphere" of Hellboy stories.
Spoof story where Abe Sapien is the top B.P.R.D. agent.
Abe Sapien & Hellboy take a break from fighting with Nazis and fight with some zombie gangsters instead.
B.P.R.D. agents try to deal with a ghost circus.
Hellboy tries to stop a monster theatre troupe from killing their fans.
An FBI agent tries to convince Hellboy to help her lure a monster that only attacks couples making out in the back seat of a car.
Hellboy tries to recover a Maya time-controlling artifact.
Hellboy visits a dysfunctional "haunted" family.
Lloyd McCay tries to set a new altitude record for freestyle jet-packing.
Hellboy meets a "hot" demon-woman at a Japanese hot spring resort.
Lobster Johnson and his assistant try to escape from a collapsing mansion.
Doc Hollow tries to stop his vibro-destructo machine from overloading.
Lobster Johnson and his assistant try to stop the Nazis from escaping with the vibro-destructo machine.
Lobster Johnson and his assistant find out the true identity of the Crimson Hood.
Lobster Johnson and his assistant confront the Crimson Hood and his Nazi allies.
Lobster Johnson finds his assistant corseted and in bondage at the villain's secret hideout.
Lobster Johnson finds out the location of the Crimson Hood's secret hideout.
Lobster Johnson tries to recapture a top-secret weapon from a Nazi villain.
A Georgian seminary student tries to stop Baba Yaga from preying on children.
ComicInfo.Tags: Astaroth,Conqueror Worm,Hecate,Vladimir Giurescu,Ann Hatch,Abe Sapien,Koschei the Deathless,Crimson Hood,Ilsa Haupstein,Grigori Rasputin,The Lobster,Dr. Kate Corrigan,Lloyd McCay,Hellboy,Baba Yaga,Azzael,Kroenen,Roger,Sadu-Hem,Trevor Bruttenholm,Josef Stalin,Robert Isherwood,Sidney Leach,Klaus Werner Von Krupt,Johann Kraus,William Grenier,Leopold Kurtz,Elizabeth Sherman,General Norton Ricker
